title: LeaverBuster
body: My computer keeps crashing in-game and it takes me about 5+ minutes to come back on and it kept LeaverBusting me to the point I have to wait 20 minutes. I can't help it if my computer crashes and I don't want to keep waiting like this. Can these things be lifted? If not, how can my crashing problem be solved?

replies.body: The fact is, by playing with a computer that frequently crashes, you are negatively impacting the game experience for the other 9 players in your games, whether intentionally or not. For the other players in the game, theres not really any difference between someone whos computer crashes and someone who afks on purpose

It's leave busters they stand for ban the good guy and honor the troll for not disconnecting and letting them pick on the wrong people.
altho in  your case i do fell soz for you bro as I have had this problem b4. It eventually solved it self over the next couple months.

> Can these things be lifted?

No, and there's a very good reason for that. If you had bothered to read either the TOU or EULA you'd know that consistent disconnections is the fault of the player. They specifically state that the player is responsible for ensuring their computer meets the hardware/software and connection requirements of the game and, since your computer continues to crash, it's completely your fault (based on the TOU and EULA).

*"But I never read the TOU and/or EULA"*
Doesn't matter. If you've agreed to them that's it, you've agreed to everything in them whether you know what's there or not (think of it like a contract). There's no denying that it's your fault since you've already admitted to that.

> If not, how can my crashing problem be solved?

Are you getting any error messages before your computer crashes or does it just go? If you are a google search with the error code should give you a few good ways to fix it. A scan using anti-virus software might be a good idea too (I use [malwarebytes](https://www.malwarebytes.org/) for scans, it's free and effective), you never know what might have made it's way onto your computer. If you've tried a bunch of stuff and still don't know what to do then it might be time to take it to a professional and, if all else fails, you can try resetting it to factory default (make a back-up before this obviously).
